abstract.text: Establishes a MIDI connection between two nodes.

inlineContent.text: , the engine uses this value for the format of the source audio node’s output bus. In all cases, the engine matches the format of the destination audio node’s input bus to the source node’s output bus.
, the source node’s event list block calls this on the real-time thread. The host can tap the MIDI data of the source node through this block.

Use this to establish a MIDI connection between a source node and a destination node that has MIDI input capability. This method disconnects any existing MIDI connection that involves the destination node. When making the MIDI connection, this method overwrites the source node’s event list block.
The source node can only be an
. The destination node types can be

abstract.text: Play, record, and process audio; configure your app’s system audio behavior.
An object that manages a graph of audio nodes, controls playback, and configures real-time rendering constraints.
Establishes a MIDI-only connection between two nodes.
Establishes a MIDI-only connection between a source node and multiple destination nodes.
Establishes a MIDI connection between two nodes.
Establishes a MIDI connection between a source node and multiple destination nodes.
Removes a MIDI connection between two nodes.
Removes a MIDI connection between one source node and multiple destination nodes.
Disconnects all input MIDI connections from a node.
Disconnects all output MIDI connections from a node.
An object that describes the representation of an audio format.
An object you use for audio generation, processing, or an I/O block.
A subclass of the audio node class that, processes audio either in real time or nonreal time, depending on the type of the audio unit.
An instrument unit can be used as a software musical instrument, such as a sampler or synthesizer. It responds to MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) control signals and can create notes.
An effect unit that can respond to MIDI control messages, typically through a mapping of  MIDI messages to parameters of the audio unit’s DSP algorithm.

inlineContent.text: , the engine uses this value for the format of the source audio node’s output bus. In all cases, the engine matches the format of the destination audio node’s input bus to the source node’s output bus.
, the source node’s event list block calls this on the real-time thread. The host can tap the MIDI data of the source node through this block.

value.text: int (^)(long long, unsigned char, const struct MIDIEventList *)
